articles.title: New Statewide Poll: Blackburn at 60.6%, Voters Overwhelmingly Back Education Accountability
articles.summary: A new survey of 500 Tennessee registered voters by Tennesseans for Student Success finds Sen. Marsha Blackburn leading the GOP primary at 60.6%, with Rep. John Rose at 8.1% and Rep. Monty Fritts at 5.1%. The poll also reveals broad education consensus: 87% support holding schools accountable, 82% back open enrollment, 81% say annual testing matters, and 64% believe education funding is not spent efficiently.

articles.title: Senator Blackburn Continues to Hold a Strong Lead in the Latest Poll of the Governor‚Äôs Race
articles.summary:
57 percent of the 463 Republican voters who responded to the January poll 
said they‚Äôd vote for Blackburn in the August primary, compared to 8 percent 
for State Representative Monty Fritts, R-Kingston, and 7 percent for 
Congressman John Rose.

articles.title: President Trump Appears to Move Closer to an Endorsement in the Tennessee Governor‚Äôs Race
articles.summary:
On Wednesday, Blackburn shared a video clip on social media of the 
President praising her at the Trump Accounts summit that day, and 
indicating he believes she‚Äôll win the race to succeed Governor Bill Lee.

articles.title: Beacon Poll: Blackburn at 56%, Rose Stalled at 9% Despite Ad Blitz
articles.summary: The January 2026 Beacon Center/TennSight poll of 1,200 registered voters shows Blackburn's lead narrowing from 68% (Aug) to 56%, but Rose hasn't gained ‚Äî he's actually dropped from 14% to 9%. Fritts has risen to 7%, and 28% of Republican voters remain undecided. The growing undecided pool is the real story.

articles.title: Preview of the 2026 Legislative Session
articles.summary: Tennessee Firefly previews the major education bills and political dynamics heading into the 2026 session ‚Äî including how the governor's race is shaping legislative priorities on vouchers, teacher pay, and school funding.

articles.title: Targoz Poll: Blackburn Leads Primary at 56%, Rose at 9%
articles.summary: January 2026 Targoz Market Research poll of 1,200 likely Republican primary voters shows Blackburn at 56%, Rose at 9%, Fritts at 7%, with 27% undecided. Commissioned by the Beacon Center of Tennessee.

articles.title: Beacon Poll: Blackburn Drops to 58%, Undecideds Surge to 28%
articles.summary: The November 2025 Beacon Center/TennSight quarterly poll shows Blackburn's support declining 10 points from August while Rose dropped from 14% to 9%. The undecided pool has doubled from 14% to 28%, suggesting Republican voters are less locked in than August numbers implied.

articles.title: Targoz Poll: Blackburn at 58%, Undecideds Growing
articles.summary: October 2025 Targoz Market Research poll shows Blackburn's lead narrowing to 58% among likely Republican primary voters, while the undecided pool has grown to 28%. Rose holds at 9%.

articles.title: Congressman John Rose Discusses His Run for Governor
articles.summary: TNFirefly's On The Fly podcast sits down with Rep. Rose for an in-depth interview on his gubernatorial campaign. Covers his background in agriculture, IT entrepreneurship, education stance, and why he decided to leave Congress.

articles.title: Quantus Insights: Blackburn Dominates Early Primary Field
articles.summary: August 2025 Quantus Insights poll of registered Republican voters finds Blackburn with a commanding lead in the GOP primary. The statewide survey is among the first independent polls of the 2026 gubernatorial race.

articles.title: Beacon Center Poll: Blackburn 68%, Rose 14% in Republican Primary
articles.summary: First major poll of the race shows Blackburn with a commanding lead among likely Republican primary voters. Rose sits at 14%, with Fritts and Pellegra in low single digits. In a hypothetical general, Blackburn leads Green 49-28.

articles.title: Targoz/Beacon Center Poll: Blackburn 68%, Rose 14% in First Major Survey
articles.summary: The first major poll of the 2026 Tennessee governor's race from Targoz Market Research for the Beacon Center shows Blackburn with a commanding 68-14 lead over Rose among likely Republican primary voters, with Fritts and Pellegra in low single digits.

articles.title: Fabrizio Lee Poll: Blackburn at 71% Among GOP Primary Voters
articles.summary: Early January 2025 poll from Fabrizio Lee & Associates shows Blackburn with overwhelming 71% support among likely Republican primary voters, the highest mark of any survey in the race. Conducted before most candidates had formally announced.
